page.title: 15PRESERVATION SOCIETY (CONT.)
page.content:
The 1951 planning permission cannot be revoked and no Local Authority would want to stop the quarrying because of the cost of compensation to the quarrying company.
Several companies have quarried the site and the present company is now nearing the end of its permitted 1951 area. Consequently it has applied for {further planning permission}to the South and the case is due to come before the County Council in November of this year. (1985)
As the matter is {sub judice}there can obviously be no discussion, but members are hopeful that they can reduce the requested quarrying area by two-thirds. You readers of the future may judge whether they were successful or not.
